label: Description
value:
Wallpaper roll.
Ceiling border corners and ornaments: in the Anglo-Japanesque style, containing fans and roses. Printed in red, tan and black on ocher ground.

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from Smithsonian Institution Collections Acquisition Program and Sarah Cooper-Hewitt Funds

label: Description
value: Wallpaper roll. Borders or sidewall: two different designs each occupying half the paper width. Stylized blue flowers on wavy background; and zig-zag motif with blue flowers. Printed in blue and metallic copper.

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from Smithsonian Institution Collections Acquisition Program and Sarah Cooper-Hewitt Funds

label: Description
value: Frieze or dado in Anglo-Japanesque style. Large red roses with other flowers printed on tan ground set within a rustic stick framework. Printed in striped ground. Ocher band with strapwork running along top and bottom edges. Printed in selvedge: "A.W.P.M.A."

label: Dimensions
value: Overall: 1546.9 x 49.5 cm (50 ft. 9 in. x 19 1/2 in.)

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from Smithsonian Institution Collections Acquisition Program and Sarah Cooper-Hewitt Funds

label: Description
value: Ceiling medallion: central eight-pointed star surrounded by large red roses and foliage, set within a square framework. Printed on tan ground.

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from Smithsonian Institution Collections Acquisition Program and Sarah Cooper-Hewitt Funds

label: Description
value: Printed three across: wood grain design of parquet flooring. Circle within a square alternating with a diamond shape. Strung beads run along either edge of borders.

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from Smithsonian Institution Collections Acquisition Program and Sarah Cooper-Hewitt Funds

label: Description
value: Set within a square framework, central stylized floral motif, surrounded by pink roses, small blue flowers and fern fronds. Three smaller square frameworks are directly opposite. The frame on either end containing a large pink rose, while the middle square contains a diagonal band.

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from Smithsonian Institution Collections Acquisition Program and Sarah Cooper-Hewitt Funds

label: Credit line
value: Gift of the Estate of Harrison Salisbury

label: Description
value: Shirt-like garment of white linen, with a full body gathered into a straight neck band, slit at front neck opening, and long sleeves narrowing to the wrist. Bobbin lace insertions at each seam are further embellished with floral embroidery in pale yellow silk, and bobbin lace trims the collar, sleeves and hem of the garment.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: linen Technique: embroidered on plain weave with bobbin lace edging Label: embroidered linen with bobbin lace edging

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. John Innes Kane and from Smithsonian Institution Collections Acquisition Program Fund

label: Notes
value: Shirt-like garment of white linen, with a full body gathered into a straight neck band, slit at front neck opening, and long sleeves narrowing to the wrist. label: Description
value: Man dressed as a fountain with jet and tier for hat, torso clad in two basins adorned with tritons, and supporting statues for legs.  Man holds tools in both hands.  Costumed man stands on garden terrace.

label: Description
value: Assorted scenes illustrating stories about the goddess Diana. In one, Acteon has just been turned into a stag, in another a wild boar ravages the fields of Calydon. In brown on white.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: printed by engraved copper plate on plain weave

label: Dimensions
value: Warp x Weft (a): 202 × 66 cm (6 ft. 7 1/2 in. × 26 in.) Warp x Weft (b): 187 × 61 cm (6 ft. 1 5/8 in. × 24 in.) Repeat H: 102 cm (40 3/16 in.)

label: Description
value: Amusing scenes of people floating around in the sky mixed with a bucolic landscape. In blue on white.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: printed by engraved copper plate on plain weave

label: Description
value: Length containing four scenes within foliate cartouches all filled with figures which illustrate a work by Voltaire called "Memnon".

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: printed by engraved copper plate on plain weave

label: Dimensions
value: Warp x Weft (both selvedges present): 254 x 96 cm (8 ft. 4 in. x 37 13/16 in.) Repeat H: 99.7 cm (39 1/4 in.)

label: Description
value: Textile has four repeating scenes representing the eruption of Mt. Vesuvius as described in the letters of Pliny the Younger to the historian Tacitus. The boy reading is Pliny trying to be calm. One of the women is his mother. A visiting friend reproves their calmness. In purple-brown on white.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: printed by engraved copper plate on plain weave

label: Dimensions
value: Warp x Weft: 218.5 x 138 cm (7 ft. 2 in. x 54 5/16 in.) Repeat H: 84.6 cm (33 5/16 in.)

label: Description
value: Zoological park with fenced enclosures containing animals.  Design in red on white ground.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton, Technique: printed by engraved cooper plate on plain weave

label: Description
value: Complex and busy pattern that includes people banqueting at a dais, a man and a woman jousting from boats, a tower with a seated couple beside it, bacchus in a chariot, nymphs ornamenting a herm, chinoiserie and scenes of feasting.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: printed by engraved copper plate on plain weave.

label: Dimensions
value: Warp x Weft: 138 x 89 cm (54 5/16 x 35 1/16 in.) Repeat H: 101.5 cm (39 15/16 in.)

label: Description
value: Incidents from the story of the same title by Miguel Cervantes. In red on white.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: printed by engraved copper plate on plain weave

label: Dimensions
value: Warp x Weft: 219.5 x 92 cm (7 ft. 2 7/16 in. x 36 1/4 in.)

label: Description
value:
Four scenes (two incomplete) illustrating the legend of Achilles before the battle at Troy. 
(Ullysses knew Achilles was disguised as a woman at the court of Lycomedes. Ulysses entered the court as a merchant and regonized Achilles when the latter selected waepons rather than embroidery or fabric.)
In black on white.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: printed by engraved copper plate on plain weave

label: Dimensions
value: Warp x Weft: 92 x 88 cm (36 1/4 x 34 5/8 in.)

label: Description
value: Four scenes, one of a mother reading a letter from Nantes to her sons, a cottage scene of parents and children, a picnic during haymaking and a domestic scene with a woman writing or drawing. In sepia on white.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: printed by enrgaved copper plate on plain weave

label: Dimensions
value: Warp x Weft: 282 x 85 cm (9 ft. 3 in. x 33 7/16 in.) Repeat H: 94 cm (37 in.)
